title: Description
description: `src/ssl_attention/models/siglip.py:23,87,94` imports `SiglipVisionConfig` and `SiglipVisionModel` (v1 classes) but loads `google/siglip2-base-patch16-224` (v2 checkpoint). This works via HuggingFace backward compatibility for fixed-resolution SigLIP2 models, but using `Siglip2VisionModel`/`Siglip2VisionConfig` would be more accurate and future-proof.

title: Description
description: `src/ssl_attention/evaluation/linear_probe.py:143-144` — after cross-validation, the classifier is refit on ALL data, then `accuracy` and `f1_macro` are computed on the same training data. The `cv_mean`/`cv_std` fields are the proper generalization estimates. The `accuracy` field is overoptimistic and could be misinterpreted as a test metric.

title: Cohen's d uses paired formula but unpaired interpretation benchmarks
description: `src/ssl_attention/metrics/statistics.py:142-149` computes d_z (Cohen's d based on SD of differences for paired samples), which tends to be larger than unpaired Cohen's d. The docstring cites unpaired benchmarks (|d| < 0.2 small, 0.2-0.8 medium, > 0.8 large). For paired d_z, these benchmarks are different, leading to potential overinterpretation of effect sizes. Ref: https://real-statistics.com/students-t-distribution/paired-sample-t-test/cohens-d-paired-samples/

title: Acceptance Criteria
description: - Update the documentation to point to `resnet50.py` as the actual Grad-CAM implementation source

title: Stratified split does not exclude bbox-annotated evaluation images
description: `src/ssl_attention/evaluation/fine_tuning.py:464-503` — _stratified_split() doesn't exclude the 139 bbox-annotated images. Fine-tuning methods doc Section 5 states these must be held out from training. Add logic to exclude bbox image IDs from training split.

title: Acceptance Criteria
description: - Either precompute metrics for all supported methods per model, or clearly indicate which method the displayed metrics correspond to in the frontend UI

title: Acceptance Criteria
description: - Update the implementation plan to correctly state SigLIP has no CLS token (196 patches only)

title: Acceptance Criteria
description: - Add logic to exclude bbox-annotated image IDs from the training split, or accept them as a parameter to exclude

title: Description
description: `app/precompute/generate_metrics_cache.py:169` only computes IoU metrics for the default method per model (CLS for DINOv2/v3/MAE/CLIP, mean for SigLIP, gradcam for ResNet). The metrics router has no `method` parameter. If a user selects "rollout" for DINOv2 in the frontend, the IoU displayed is still for "cls" method — silently misleading.

title: Description
description: `src/ssl_attention/metrics/pointing_game.py:72-82` uses strict containment — the max attention point must fall exactly within the bbox. The standard Pointing Game protocol (Zhang et al. 2016 "Top-down Neural Attention by Excitation Backprop") specifies a 15-pixel tolerance margin around ground truth bounding boxes. This stricter variant could underreport pointing accuracy compared to literature benchmarks.

title: Acceptance Criteria
description: - Either implement LoRA fine-tuning or update the documentation to mark it as "planned/not yet implemented"

title: Phase 4: Visualization & Interactive Analysis
description: Build interactive visualization system comparing SSL attention patterns against 631 expert-annotated bounding boxes on 139 WikiChurches images. Combines Phase 4 (static visualization) and Phase 6 (interactive demo).

title: Metrics don't account for user-selected attention method
description: `app/precompute/generate_metrics_cache.py:169` only computes IoU metrics for the default method per model (CLS for DINOv2/v3/MAE/CLIP, mean for SigLIP, gradcam for ResNet). The metrics router has no `method` parameter. If a user selects "rollout" for DINOv2 in the frontend, the IoU displayed is still for "cls" method — silently misleading. Either precompute metrics for all methods or clearly indicate which method the displayed metrics correspond to.

title: LoRA fine-tuning not implemented despite documentation
description: `docs/enhancements/fine_tuning_methods.md` extensively describes LoRA as Tier 2, but `src/ssl_attention/evaluation/fine_tuning.py` only supports full fine-tuning and linear probe. No LoRA integration exists. Either implement LoRA or update docs to mark it as planned/not yet implemented.

title: Description
description: `docs/research/attention_methods.md` and `docs/reference/attention_heatmap_implementation.md` show:

title: Description
description: `src/ssl_attention/attention/gradcam.py:146` computes `weights = self._gradients.mean(dim=-1, keepdim=True)` which averages over the feature/embedding dimension instead of the spatial dimension. For standard Grad-CAM, gradients should be averaged over spatial tokens. This is dead code — the actual Grad-CAM used for ResNet-50 is correctly implemented in `src/ssl_attention/models/resnet50.py:207-244`. The `gradcam.py` class is not invoked in the pipeline.

title: Random baseline seeding uses non-deterministic hash()
description: `src/ssl_attention/metrics/baselines.py:260` uses `seed=trial * 1000 + hash(annotation.image_id) % 1000`. Python's hash() is randomized across sessions (PYTHONHASHSEED), making results not perfectly reproducible across processes. Fix: use hashlib.md5 or similar deterministic hash.

Need to: 1) Update app/precompute/generate_attention_cache.py to generate all 3 methods, 2) Add method parameter to /api/attention endpoints, 3) Add method selector to ControlPanel.tsx

Fixed real bug: LoRA checkpoint naming mismatch — producer saves {model}_lora_finetuned.pt but discover_checkpoints(), load_finetuned_model(), and get_available_checkpoints() only looked for {model}_finetuned.pt. All three consumers now check both patterns, preferring LoRA when both exist. Empty checkpoints dir is operational (needs re-training), not a code gap.

title: Description
description: `src/ssl_attention/metrics/baselines.py:88` computes center as `height / 2` (=112.0 for 224px), but pixel indices run 0-223, so the true center is 111.5. The Gaussian peak is shifted 0.5 pixels right/bottom. Negligible in practice but technically incorrect.

title: Description

For SigLIP (method=`"mean"`) and ResNet-50 (method=`"gradcam"`), heatmap lookups always fail because files are stored under `{model}/layer{N}/mean/` or `gradcam/`, not `cls/`.

title: Description
description: `docs/research/attention_methods.md:533` states "CAM paper (Zhou et al., 2016) introduced both IoU and the Pointing Game for evaluating localization." The Pointing Game was actually introduced by Zhang et al. (2016) "Top-down Neural Attention by Excitation Backprop" (ECCV 2016). Zhou et al. (2016) introduced IoU-based localization evaluation but NOT the Pointing Game.

title: Metrics cache generation stuck on ResNet-50 aggregation
description:
## Problem

The `generate_metrics_cache` script gets stuck after processing ResNet-50's image metrics, during the aggregate computation phase. The process runs at 100% CPU but never completes.

## Observed Behavior

- All 5 ViT models complete successfully (dinov2, dinov3, mae, clip, siglip)
- Each produces 11,676 metric records
- ResNet-50 progress bar completes (139 images)
- Script then hangs during 'Computing aggregates for resnet50...'
- Process runs at 100% CPU indefinitely (tested for 5+ minutes)

## Impact

- ResNet-50 metrics missing from Dashboard
- Cache regeneration cannot complete cleanly

## Reproduction

```bash
python -m app.precompute.generate_metrics_cache
```

Watch for the script to hang after:
```
resnet50: 100%|██████████| 139/139
Computing aggregates for resnet50...
```

## Investigation Areas

1. Check `generate_metrics_cache.py` aggregate computation logic
2. ResNet-50 uses different layer structure (layer0-3 vs layer0-11 for ViTs)
3. ResNet-50 uses 'gradcam' variant vs 'cls'/'rollout' for ViTs
4. Possible infinite loop or expensive query in aggregate SQL

title: Pointing Game lacks standard 15-pixel tolerance margin
description: `src/ssl_attention/metrics/pointing_game.py:72-82` uses strict containment — the max attention point must fall exactly within the bbox. The standard Pointing Game protocol (Zhang et al. 2016 "Top-down Neural Attention by Excitation Backprop") specifies a 15-pixel tolerance margin around ground truth bboxes. This stricter variant could underreport pointing accuracy compared to literature benchmarks. Either add the tolerance as an option or document this as a "strict pointing game" variant.

title: Description
description: `app/frontend/src/utils/renderHeatmap.ts:10-62` — the `TURBO` colormap array contains only 253 entries instead of the expected 256. The array stops at `[122, 4, 3]` (index 252), meaning the highest attention values (very close to 1.0) map to slightly wrong colors. Visual impact is minimal but technically incorrect.

title: StandardScaler fit on all data before cross-validation (data leakage)
description: `src/ssl_attention/evaluation/linear_probe.py:128` fits StandardScaler on ALL data before CV. Scaler sees validation fold data — technically data leakage. Small bias for logistic regression but protocol should scale within each CV fold. Fix: use Pipeline(StandardScaler(), LogisticRegression()).

title: Description
description: `src/ssl_attention/evaluation/linear_probe.py:128` fits `StandardScaler` on ALL data before cross-validation, meaning the scaler sees validation fold data. This is technically data leakage, though the bias is small for logistic regression. Proper protocol scales within each CV fold.

title: SigLIP docstring says mean pooling but SigLIP2 uses MAP attention pooling
description: `src/ssl_attention/models/siglip.py:103` docstring says "pooled representation (mean over patches)". SigLIP2 actually uses MAP (Multi-head Attention Pooling), not arithmetic mean. Code logic is correct (uses pooler_output regardless), but docstring is inaccurate.

title: Acceptance Criteria
description: - Clarify labels to distinguish "patch pixel size" from "grid dimensions" (e.g., "14px patches -> 16x16 grid = 256 patches")

title: Center Gaussian baseline off by 0.5 pixels
description: `src/ssl_attention/metrics/baselines.py:88` computes center as `height / 2` (=112.0 for 224px), but pixel indices run 0-223, so true center is 111.5. Gaussian peak shifted 0.5px right/bottom. Negligible in practice. Fix: use `(height - 1) / 2`.

title: Metrics card ignores bbox selection — IoU/Coverage always computed against union of all bboxes
description:
## Problem

When a user selects an individual bounding box in the Annotations panel (e.g., 'Round Arch Window'), the IoU Score and Coverage metrics card does not update to reflect that specific bbox. The metrics always show values computed against the union of ALL bounding boxes for the image.

## Root Cause

The metrics are pre-computed using `annotation.get_union_mask()` (union of all bboxes) and stored in SQLite keyed by `(image_id, model, layer, method, percentile)`. The `selectedBboxIndex` state in the frontend is never passed to the metrics API — it only affects the visual overlay rendering.

### Code path:
- `ImageDetail.tsx:39-45`: `useImageMetrics(decodedId, model, layer, percentile, method)` — no bbox index param
- `useAttention.ts:32-33`: query key and API call omit bbox selection
- `metrics_service.py`: queries SQLite by `(image_id, model, layer, method, percentile)` only
- `generate_metrics_cache.py`: pre-computes with `compute_image_iou()` which calls `get_union_mask()`

## Expected Behavior

When a bbox is selected, the metrics card should update to show IoU/Coverage for that specific bbox vs the attention map. When no bbox is selected (or selection is cleared), show the current union-of-all-bboxes metric.

## Notes

- `compute_per_bbox_iou()` already exists in `iou.py:317-348` and is used during precompute for the Feature Breakdown table
- Per-bbox metrics could be pre-computed and stored in a new SQLite table, or computed on-the-fly since single-bbox IoU is cheap
- Coverage for a single bbox would use `compute_coverage(attention, single_bbox_mask)` instead of the union mask
- Verified via Playwright testing: clicking different bboxes (Round Arch Window 9%x11%, Blind Arcade 19%x17%) produces zero change in displayed metrics
close_reason: Resolved: per-bbox metrics now update in the UI when a bbox is selected (commit c7aaccf)

Dead code — actual Grad-CAM for ResNet-50 is correctly implemented in `resnet50.py:207-244`. Either fix the ViT Grad-CAM or remove/deprecate the unused class.

Verified by programmatic count (regex) and entry-by-entry comparison against the official Google Research Turbo colormap reference (Anton Mikhailov). All 256 float-to-int conversions match. No code changes needed.

title: Regenerate metrics cache after IoU topk fix
description:
## Context

Commit 9ce6a22 changed `threshold_attention` from `torch.quantile` to `torch.topk`, fixing variable pixel counts due to tied values (#x03). All precomputed metrics were generated with the old quantile logic and are now stale.

## Artifacts to regenerate

1. **Metrics DB** (`outputs/cache/metrics.db`) — all 4 tables: `image_metrics`, `aggregate_metrics`, `style_metrics`, `feature_metrics`
2. **Summary JSON** (`outputs/cache/metrics_summary.json`) — auto-generated at end of metrics cache script
3. **Delta IoU JSON** (`outputs/results/delta_iou_analysis.json`) — only if needed for reporting

## Not affected

- `outputs/cache/attention_viz.h5` (raw attention, pre-threshold)
- `outputs/cache/features.h5` (embeddings, unrelated)
- `outputs/cache/heatmaps/` (rendered from raw attention)
- Frontend/backend code (no changes needed)

## Commands

```bash
python -m app.precompute.generate_metrics_cache --models all --no-skip
python experiments/scripts/analyze_delta_iou.py
```

Note: `--no-skip` is required to overwrite existing stale entries.

The /models endpoint should return per-model layer counts, and the frontend should adapt the layer slider range based on the selected model. Currently the UI shows layers 0-11 for ResNet-50, but only layers 0-3 exist (404 for others).

These are recommended in fine_tuning_methods.md Section 8 and important for training stability with small datasets. Note: LR warmup partially tracked in existing issue ssl_wikichurches-o63.

title: Threshold percentile options inconsistent across UI and backend cache
description:
## Problem

Three layers of percentile threshold options are out of sync:

1. **Backend cache** (`generate_metrics_cache.py:41`): 7 levels — `[90, 85, 80, 75, 70, 60, 50]`
2. **ControlPanel** (`ControlPanel.tsx:96-102`, ImageDetail page): 5 levels — `[90, 80, 70, 60, 50]` (missing 85, 75)
3. **Dashboard** (`Dashboard.tsx:79-83`): 3 levels — `[90, 80, 70]` (missing 85, 75, 60, 50)

## Decisions Needed

### 1. How many thresholds should the UI expose?
- **Option A: All 7** — Matches the precomputed cache. Gives users finer granularity (85th/75th percentile). May clutter the dropdown.
- **Option B: Keep 5** — Current ControlPanel set `[90, 80, 70, 60, 50]`. Clean 10% increments. The 85th/75th are still available for programmatic analysis scripts.
- **Option C: Other** — e.g., only 3, or a custom subset.

### 2. Should both UI locations offer the same options?
The ControlPanel (ImageDetail page) has 5 options but the Dashboard only has 3. Should they be consistent?

## Files
- `app/frontend/src/components/attention/ControlPanel.tsx:96-102`
- `app/frontend/src/pages/Dashboard.tsx:79-83`
- `app/precompute/generate_metrics_cache.py:41`
- `docs/core/project_proposal.md:93` (describes threshold levels)

## Context
Discovered during cross-reference of project proposal against implementation. The proposal was updated to say "7 percentile levels" based on the backend cache, but the UI tells a different story.

title: Add learning rate warmup scheduler to fine_tuning.py
description: Optional: Proposal mentions warmup but not implemented. Either implement LinearWarmupScheduler or remove warmup mention from proposal. Low priority.

title: No React error boundaries in frontend application

title: Description
description: `src/ssl_attention/metrics/pointing_game.py:244` uses `results[bbox.label] = bool(hit)` which overwrites if an image has multiple bboxes with the same label. Only the last result for each label is kept, potentially losing information.

title: Rollout formula in docs differs from code implementation
description: `docs/research/attention_methods.md` and `docs/reference/attention_heatmap_implementation.md` show `R_i = normalize((A_i + I) @ R_{i-1})` — normalize after multiply. Code in `rollout.py:80-93` does `R_i = normalize(A_i + I) @ R_{i-1}` — normalize before multiply. Code also has extra pre-normalization of attn (line 80) before adding identity, not in formula. These are mathematically different operations. Update docs to match code.

title: Description
description: `app/backend/main.py:83-88` has a catch-all exception handler that returns `str(exc)` directly to the client. This could leak internal implementation details (file paths, stack trace fragments) in production.

title: Linear probe reports training accuracy as accuracy field
description: `src/ssl_attention/evaluation/linear_probe.py:143-144` — after cross-validation, the classifier is refit on ALL data, then `accuracy` and `f1_macro` are computed on the same training data. The `cv_mean`/`cv_std` are the proper generalization estimates. The `accuracy` field is overoptimistic and could be misinterpreted. Either remove it, rename to `train_accuracy`, or add a docstring note.

title: SigLIP uses v1 classes for v2 model checkpoint
description: `src/ssl_attention/models/siglip.py:23,87,94` imports SiglipVisionConfig/SiglipVisionModel (v1 classes) for google/siglip2-base-patch16-224 (v2 checkpoint). Works via HuggingFace backward compatibility but Siglip2VisionModel/Siglip2VisionConfig would be more accurate and future-proof.

title: Comparison router missing method parameter — SigLIP/ResNet heatmaps never appear
description: `app/backend/routers/comparison.py` calls `heatmap_exists()` without a `method` parameter at lines 66, 110, 114, and 166, defaulting to `"cls"`. For SigLIP (method=`"mean"`) and ResNet-50 (method=`"gradcam"`), heatmap lookups always fail because files are stored under `{model}/layer{N}/mean/` or `gradcam/`, not `cls/`. SigLIP and ResNet-50 heatmaps silently never appear in comparison views.

title: Description
description: `docs/enhancements/fine_tuning_methods.md:376-386` proposes a `src/ssl_attention/finetune/` directory with `trainer.py`, `lora_adapter.py`, `losses.py`, `schedulers.py`. The actual implementation is a single file at `src/ssl_attention/evaluation/fine_tuning.py`. The proposed structure was never implemented.

title: Description
description: `src/ssl_attention/metrics/statistics.py:142-149` computes d_z (Cohen's d based on SD of differences for paired samples), which tends to be larger than unpaired Cohen's d. The docstring cites unpaired benchmarks (|d| < 0.2 small, 0.2-0.8 medium, > 0.8 large). For paired d_z, these benchmarks are different, leading to potential overinterpretation of effect sizes.

title: ResNet-50 Grad-CAM does not clear gradients between inference calls
description: **Priority**: P3 | **Type**: bug

title: Description
description: `src/ssl_attention/evaluation/fine_tuning.py:573-579` lacks:

title: Implement Phase 2: Data Pipeline
close_reason: Implemented Phase 2 data pipeline: config updates, data/ package (annotations.py, wikichurches.py), cache/ package (manager.py), fixed style mapping docs

title: IoU thresholding selects variable pixel counts due to tied quantile values
description: **Priority**: P2 | **Type**: bug

title: Description
description: `docs/research/attention_methods.md` documents the Grad-CAM source as `src/ssl_attention/attention/gradcam.py`. The actual Grad-CAM used for ResNet-50 is implemented in `src/ssl_attention/models/resnet50.py:207-244`. The `gradcam.py` file contains a ViT Grad-CAM class that is not used in the pipeline.

title: Phase 1: Core Infrastructure Implementation
description: Build foundational ML infrastructure for comparing SSL model attention patterns. Includes model wrappers for 5 SSL models (DINOv2, DINOv3, MAE, CLIP, SigLIP 2) with unified attention extraction.
close_reason: Phase 1 infrastructure complete: 5 model wrappers, attention extractors, registry with caching

title: Acceptance Criteria
description: - Either fix the ViT Grad-CAM implementation or remove/deprecate the unused class to avoid confusion

title: Description
description: `docs/enhancements/fine_tuning_methods.md` extensively describes LoRA as Tier 2, but `src/ssl_attention/evaluation/fine_tuning.py` only supports full fine-tuning and linear probe (freeze_backbone=True/False). No LoRA integration exists. This is a feature gap between documentation and implementation.

title: Extract per-layer features instead of final layer only
description:
Current limitation: generate_feature_cache.py stores the same final-layer features for all layer keys. 

For more accurate per-layer similarity analysis, the script should hook into each transformer layer to extract intermediate features. This would require modifying the model forward pass to capture hidden states at each layer.

Impact: Currently, changing the layer slider won't show different similarity patterns since all layers use the same features.

title: FastAPI app missing startup/shutdown lifecycle hooks
description: **Priority**: P3 | **Type**: feature

title: Run generate_feature_cache.py to populate feature cache
description:
The interactive bbox similarity feature requires precomputed patch features. Run:

```bash
python -m app.precompute.generate_feature_cache --models all
```

This will generate ~4.9 GB of cached features in outputs/cache/features.h5
close_reason: Feature cache generated successfully: 4.7GB, 8340 entries across 5 models

title: Generic exception handler leaks internal error messages
description: `app/backend/main.py:83-88` catch-all exception handler returns `str(exc)` to client. Could leak internal file paths and stack trace fragments in production. Return generic message in production mode, log full exception server-side.

title: Add interactive bbox similarity comparison to ModelCompare page
description:
Add clickable bounding boxes to Model Comparison page that show similarity heatmaps for both models simultaneously when clicked, allowing users to compare how different models see the same architectural feature.

Implementation:
- Created SimilarityViewer component with bbox overlay + similarity heatmap
- Updated ModelCompare to use synchronized bbox selection across panels  
- Added selection info bar, clear button, and colormap legend
- Similarity stats (min-max) displayed on each panel

Files:
- app/frontend/src/components/comparison/SimilarityViewer.tsx (new)
- app/frontend/src/components/comparison/ModelCompare.tsx (modified)
- app/frontend/src/pages/Compare.tsx (modified)

title: Grad-CAM source file documented incorrectly
description: `docs/research/attention_methods.md` documents Grad-CAM source as `src/ssl_attention/attention/gradcam.py`. Actual Grad-CAM for ResNet-50 is in `src/ssl_attention/models/resnet50.py:207-244`. The gradcam.py ViT class is unused. Update doc to point to correct source.
